divs: sighting detailsmy neighbor knowcked on my door around 9:20pm august 22, 2009. i ws just watching tv. she said, come out side, there are ufos. i was afraid to go out, but i did. over her house - facing north east - was this orange glowing firball moving slowing up from the horizon heading south west directly towards us. they were below the cloudline, and moving very slowly - almost floating accross the sky. they were not hot air balloons, and not fireworks, as the airport suggested there were fireworks in louisville, but then they would have been coming from south west to north east and not vice versa. and they didn't look anything like a firework i had seen. these were some kind of a craft - a round object that would rise above into the sky and then seem to fizzle out before it disappeared, all around the same spot. then, we saw more. sometimes in pairs, sometimes one at a time. my neighbor saw three at a time in a triangular shape prior to coming to get me. one of them separated from the trio and went higher. i we called some more neighbors out and i called my husband and parents. my parents drove down to north canton. they didn't see anything in the sky on the drive down. the lights finally stopped coming around 10:00, but resumed after my parents arrived, around 10:40pm. this time we saw two sets of pairs floating in the sky. depending on how far away they were it resembled either an oval\disc or a circle. they were just these glowing, almost firelike balls. they seemed to flicker like a candle would as they went by and eventually they disappeared. again, they were orange and would rise from northeast and head straight towards us, sw.... low flying - above the trees and below the clouds. they were very slow moving, slower than a blimp. and completely silent. we heard no noise at all with them, and when planes went by we heard the planes. altogether, there were ten of us that watched them floating by us. we were both fascinated and frightened. my neighbor reported it to the airport, they had her continue to call as she saw them. they said they do not know what it is, all they can guess according to the sheriff was fireworks from louisville, but again, it was coming from the wrong direction to be louisville. my mom recorded some video on her cell phone. i'm waiting for her to send it to me. by 11:30pm, we hadn't seen any for about 15 minutes and all decided to go in our houses. i went to bed, locked all the doors and barricaded them so no one - or no thing - could get in.
Summary: over 20 orange balls of fire seem to float accross the sky in north canton
